conanQuotes.quoteText: Is a reason necessary? I don't know why you would kill someone but as for saving someone...a logical mind isn't needed, right?
A trick is nothing but a puzzle mankind came up with. If you use your head, you can uncover the logical answer.
Courage is a word of justice. It means the quality of mind that enables one to face apprehension with confidence and resolution. It is not right to use it as an excuse to kill someone.
I don't mind waiting for people. Because the longer you wait, the happier you feel when you finally meet again.
Memories of someone who’s passed away remains beautiful forever and a person’s heart will linger over them, they say.

It’s like an automated vending machine for canned juice. You’ll get what you want so long as you have the money, but...you get nothing in return without it. You can’t buy your way into the hearts of others.
You must not forget if that's an important memory to you...especially since when a person dies, he can only live in the memories of others...
Fear of death is worse than death itself...
You can't cure your own suffering by making others suffer.
